text: Conservative Twitter seems to believe today’s #MuellerInvestigation news shows @RepSwalwell and others have egg on their face. Probably a premature take. Nobody knows what’s in the report yet. #MuellerTime
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Castro Valley’s own Rachel @maddow was fishing today when news of the #MuellerReport broke. Said she didn’t catch any fish. No surprise since she probably honed her fishing skills at Lake Chabot.
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Hayward City Council referral debate got really personal
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Alameda County Board of Supervisors will approve next Tuesday $1M in Measure A1 funding to #Alameda for a 20-unit affordable housing project on Everett and Eagle. #alamtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: ... and the letdown begins. #MuellerTime #MuellerReport
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Alameda voters: If you’re not yet a registered voter, the deadline to participate in the April 9 Alameda special election is this Monday, Mar. 25. @ACVOTE
author: eastbaycitizen

text: I tell my Republican friends not to worry about the demise of the GOP in California, Gavin Newsom is going to help them out.
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Last week, I wrote about San Leandro's Rent Review Board having nothing to do for months. Their streak continues. The March meeting is canceled for lack of business items.
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Interesting that Obama deported New Mexico State in the Sweet 16. #marchmadness #NCAATournament
author: eastbaycitizen

text: I’m struck by how well @RoKhanna fills this big stage. It’s something people notice.
author: eastbaycitizen

text: New hot spot for housing activism is Hayward. City’s new Housing and Homelessness Cmte meets for the first time Thursday evening. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: I didn’t hear one for the entire report like you motioned for. I could be wrong but I was wondering why they were asking you for friendly amendments without being seconded.
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Hayward City Council referral debate got really personal http://ebcitizen.com/2019/03/20/hayward-city-council-referral-debate-got-really-personal/ …
author: eastbaycitizen

text: What the city manager attempted last night typically leads to her eventual dismissal or moving on her own to another job. This is sort of how the Alameda city manager scandal last year began. My expert opinion: She leaves within the next 2 years.
author: eastbaycitizen

text:
Wednesday's Briefing: College admissions scandal comes to Cal; friends mourn Victor McElhaney in L.A. |
   
East Bay Express
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Everything you want to know about @RepEricSwalwell and the clues for how he might run his campaign for president. My cover story in the Express:
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Pick up the latest @EastBayExpress and read my cover story on President Swalwell. His history may give clues to how he runs his likely campaign for prez. #CA15
author: eastbaycitizen

text: What you’re suppose to say is “Donate to Berkeleyside and East Bay Citizen, instead.”
author: eastbaycitizen

text: $189 for 3 months daily delivery of the @sfchronicle? That’s a horrible deal especially for someone in the East Bay. You know, since they act like you don’t exist.
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Hayward referral vote was 5-2. No: Wahab, Salinas. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Just in: Things got personal at Hayward City Council before approving reforms to its council referral process. But a controversial limit on the number of referrals per year by a councilmember proposed by the city manager is not included. #haymtg – bei Hayward City Hall
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Halliday offers friendly amendment to strike limit on number of referrals from motion. Zermeno accepts. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: I can’t keep up!
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Hayward CM @emarqana says @aishabbwahab is serving her own agenda. If one of her sentences are incorrect, Wahab will go on CBS News and go on a “Twitter tantrum.” #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: This #haymtg has officially gone off the rails.
author: eastbaycitizen

text: .@aishabbwahab says proposed 5/yr per councilmember rule is unconstitutional, violates equal protection clause. Would welcome a constitutional attorney to look at it. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: .@aishabbwahab is on a roll. She says when first sworn in, a member of the council asked her wrote down all of her ideas so we can review it. She says that’s a violation of the Brown Act. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Appears to be a kinship here between @salinasforhwd and @aishabbwahab. He tells #haymtg that everyone on the council, except Wahab, ran “Hard. Hard!” against him. Scoffs at council togetherness. “Make no mistake, we don’t work together.”
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Hayward CM @FranciscZermeno makes a motion to approve the entire referral proposal. No second. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Referral power is a hammer,” says @AlMendall. “Not every community need is a nail.” The referrals Wahab has made include min. wage, equal work for equal pay, mental health training for police, rent control. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Hayward CM @AlMendall is talking down @aishabbwahab, suggesting she has some things to learn. Context here: She’s already the biggest new star in all of East Bay politics. It took her three months. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Man in the back of the chambers has been heckling Hayward Mayor Halliday all night. "Time to retire mayor!" "Florida is nice this time of the year." #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Martha Kreeger says Hayward City Council risks an imbalance in its power structure. "Don't limit your own power. Don't limit your own voices," she tells the council. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Hayward city mgr says the council referral staff report did not take much time to compile. If I had to contact 17 different municipalities, that would take me days. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Speaker Eduardo Orozco: "Are you ready to give the city mgr this much power? he asked CM Zermeno. "What are you doing? Why do we need you? Take you out and we'll just talk directly to the city manager." #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Wahab on proposed limit on council referrals to 5/yr: "The reaason why we're elected is to represent," she said. If not, "How useless is our government? How useless is our representatives?" #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: The council referral policy proposed by Hayward City Mgr McAdoo is similar to Alameda. But no city has a clause that limits how many times an elected official can offer them. Sounds like a violation of free speech. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Hayward City Manager Kelly McAdoo's tone toward Wahab is shockingly insubordinate. Try to talking to your boss in this way. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Quite a moment in Hayward. Councilmember @aishabbwahab is going to toe-to-toe with the city manager over referral proposal that would limit referrals to 5/yr. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Hayward resident Educardo Orozco wants city to fire police officer who shot Gonsalez. But who can do it, he asks. City Manager Kelly McAdoo? “It’s becoming obvious to me that she runs the show.” #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: If the mayor only responds to campaign contributions, says speaker (Mayor Halliday was backed by Hayward POA), then here’s a check. She mocks the mayor with a real check made to Halliday for the city’s maximum contribution of $1,424. #haymtg – bei Hayward City Hall
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Great deal of belittling and catcalls being lobbed at Hayward City Council and staff, particularly City Manager Kelly McAdoo. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: “Who’s accountable?” asks Karla Gonsalez, mother of Agustin Gonsalez. Says she doesn’t know who to talk to. Pressing Mayor Halliday. The mayor? City manager? “Where is the real justice going to come from for my son?” #haymtg – bei Hayward City Hall
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Jessica Nunes, cousin of Agustin Gonsalez, says she been in the activist community, but this is strange for her, she said. “Instead of chanting a stranger’s name, I’m chanting my cousin’s name.” #haymtg – bei Hayward City Hall
author: eastbaycitizen

text: One thing is for sure being a Hayward elected official is no longer the most kickback job in East Bay government. #haymtg – bei Hayward City Hall
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Later tonight at #haymtg.
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Family and friends of Agustin Gonsalez, 29yo killed last last Nov, by Hayward Police, with numerous critical comments at tonight’s #haymtg. – bei Hayward City Hall
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Earlier, Hayward City Attorney Michael Lawson issued a statement telling the city council and city staff to refrain from publicly talking about the Agustin Gonsalez shooting. Family has filed a lawsuit against the city. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Family and friends of Agustin Gonsalez, 29yo who was killed by Hayward Police last Nov, are again demanding the city council start an independent investigation of the shooting. #haymtg
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Power grab at Hayward City Hall? City manager seeks to control council referrals

text: I suppose this isn't a good time to note Devin Nunes' is probably the type of Portuguese guy whose mom still irons his underwear AKA "cuecas."

text: .@TulsiGabbard was in Fremont last weekend stumping for president. @BernieSanders is coming to Fort Mason in SF on Mar. 24 and @PeteButtigieg is coming to the @cwclub on Mar. 28. #CAprimary
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Great thread from @josephgeha16 on the Fremont City Council and Police welcoming the surveillance state under the nose of the public. Only in Fremont is the lyrics, "I always feel like someone is watching me," viewed as a comforting anthem.

text: Peter Liu is also the self-described "World's Greatest Leader."
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Liu ran for Oakland mayor last year on a platform to expand the city's economy by turning Lake Merritt into water park. In 2014, he was featured on Jimmy Kimmel Live. Liu received over 10k votes last June for CA governor.
author: eastbaycitizen

text: Two-time Oakland mayoral candidate and California gubernatiorial candidate @PeterLiuCAGov18 says he's running for @RepSwalwell's #CA15 seat "since the dude is gonna be President *wink *wink."
author: eastbaycitizen

text: http://EBCitizen.com  is a little thin recently. That's because I was working on a 4,000-word piece on President Swalwell. Look for it in the East Bay Express on Wednesday!
author: eastbaycitizen

text: So many people wearing A’s hats on Park Street today. Everyone has baseball fever. #alameda #RootedInOakland

text: Beto: “avocado toast incarnate.” Classic!
author: eastbaycitizen

text: We had to lick ours off the chest of our waitress - Vanessa.

text: Dear Twittersphere, I’m at the Sharks game and my buddy orders us two Kamakazis. Isn’t this an old school drink? Doesn’t it date us as two former presidents of the Beverly Hills 90210 Fan Club?
author: eastbaycitizen

text: The weather today feels like baseball is coming!
